sentences.en: ‘Do I look as if I am jesting?’ she asked, her face pale and tense.
sentences.cn: “难道我看上去像是在开玩笑？”她问道，脸色苍白，神情紧张。

sentences.en: A young machine hand, attracted by her looks, made bold to jest with her.
sentences.cn: 一位年轻的机工, 被她的美貌所吸引, 壮着胆子跟她开玩笑.

sentences.en: Don't jest with me, young man.
Don't say that, even in jest.
sentences.cn: 别那么说，即便是开玩笑也不行。

sentences.en: For a jest, my prince, we did exchange garments.
sentences.cn: 王子, 我们为了好玩, 彼此换了衣服.

sentences.en: He was so vain and reckless that he would break a friendship, rather than not break a jest.
sentences.cn: 他是如此虚荣狂妄,宁可和人翻脸, 有笑话却不能不说.

sentences.en: I said you look terrible in jest, actually, you look very pretty.
sentences.cn: 我说你看上去很糟糕是开玩笑, 其实你看上去很漂亮.

sentences.en: I wasn’t sure whether to treat her words as a jest.
sentences.cn: 我吃不准是否该把她的话当成玩笑。

sentences.en: It was a jest rather than a reproach.
sentences.cn: 这与其说是责备，还不如说是句玩笑呢。

sentences.en: Many a true word is spoken in jest.
No one could tell whether he was in earnest or in jest.
sentences.cn: 谁都不知道他是认真的还是在开玩笑。

sentences.en: Soames, scenting the approach of a jest , closed up.
sentences.cn: 索来斯觉察出有点调侃的味儿来了, 赶快把话打断.

sentences.en: They made a jest of his ignorance.
Would I jest about such a thing?
You cannot be always sure whether he is in jest or earnest.
sentences.cn: 你总是闹不清他究竟是开玩笑呢还是认真.

words.tran_cn: 爱开玩笑的；打趣的；滑稽的
（中世纪宫廷或贵族家中的）小丑；爱开玩笑的人

trans.tran_cn: 笑话，玩笑，戏谑，诙谐，笑柄
trans.tran_en: something you say that is intended to be funny, not serious
to say things that you do not really mean in order to amuse people
